abstract: Cuba is poised to increase Internet access, introducing some three dozen Wi-Fi hot spots around island and reducing steep fees; move comes as part of normalizing diplomatic relations with United States.
lead_paragraph: Cuba, one of the Western Hemisphere’s least-wired countries, is poised to expand access to the Internet by introducing some three dozen Wi-Fi hot spots around the island and reducing the steep fees.

headline.main: Cuba Offers Its Citizens Better Access to Internet
headline.print_headline: Cuba Offers Its Citizens Better Access to Internet

snippet: Cuba, one of the Western Hemisphere’s least-wired countries, is poised to expand access to the Internet by introducing some three dozen Wi-Fi hot spots around the island and reducing the steep fees.
